abstract_summ: Deterministic mathematical models (called Compartmental models) of disease propagation such as the SIR model and its variants (MSIR, Carrier state, SEIR, SEIS, MSEIR, MSEIRS models) are used to study the propagation of COVID19 in a large population with specific reference to India.Exponential increase of numbers of infected people is determined by the half period of the maximal latent time for the COVID-19.The averaging over latent period leads to additional increase of the infected numbers.The specific feature of the COVID-19 characterized by its long latent period is taken into account.The resulting algorithm has been successfully tested to predict the turning point reached by the epidemic curve followed by the CoViD19 virus in Italy.
title_summ: Modelling and simulation of COVID-19 propagation in a large population with specific reference to IndiaCoViD19 Meta heuristic optimization based forecast method on time dependent bootstrapped dataInitial stage of the COVID-19 infection process in human population
title_abstract_phrases: Modelling and simulation of COVID-19 propagation in a large population with specific reference to IndiaDeterministic mathematical models (called Compartmental models) of disease propagation such as the SIR model and its variants (MSIR, Carrier state, SEIR, SEIS, MSEIR, MSEIRS models) are used to study the propagation of COVID19 in a large population with specific reference to India.CoViD19 Meta heuristic optimization based forecast method on time dependent bootstrapped dataA compounded method, exploiting the searching capabilities of an operation research algorithm and the power of bootstrap techniques, is presented.Initial stage of the COVID-19 infection process in human populationThe simplest approximation for the first stages of the infection spread is considered.The averaging over latent period leads to additional increase of the infected numbers.Exponential increase of numbers of infected people is determined by the half period of the maximal latent time for the COVID-19.
